resources.string: 2. How can you handle multiple exceptions? Choose all that apply:
a. with a single catch block that handles all \n}catch (Exception e){
b. with multiple catch blocks for each exception
c. with a multi-catch block \n}catch (FileNotFoundException | EOFException e){
d. with all exceptions in one block \n}catch (FileNotFoundException, EOFException, NullPointerException){
b. An exception is an event that occurs during the execution of a program that disrupts the normal flow of instructions.
a. A subclass of Throwable that indicates serious problems that a reasonable application should not try to catch.
c. Unknown error, that mostly happen at run time.
d. An event, caused by the environment in which application is running, possible to recover from.
4. Mark all that are instances of Error or its subclass:
a. Provides the names of the classes and methods that were called, from the start of the application to the poin an exception occured.
b. Provides the name of the exception that was thrown.
c. Provides the name of the method that caused the exception.
d. Provides the names of the classes and methods that were not called due to exception.
7. Mark all that are true about exceptions:
a. Exceptions can be checked type and unchecked type.
b. All exceptions are unchecked type.
c. All exceptions are known to compiler.
d. Checked exceptions are known to compiler and unchecked exceptions are not known.
8. The \"try\" statement should contain at least:
c. one catch block and one finally block
d. one catch or finally block
9. What exception will be thrown by this code?
10. Which class is the super class for Exception and Error?
